ref: 8868 prastha1 m. ʻ flat land ʼ MBh. [The basic mng. seems to be ʻ flat ʼ (~ OSlav. prostƶ ʻ simple ʼ?), cf. prastha<-> ʻ vistāraḥ ʼ lex. and in Pa. and NIA.; also vanaprastha<-> prob. ʻ forest wilderness ʼ rather than ʻ forest situated on elevated land ʼ BR, vānaprastha -- ʻ living in wilderness ʼ. Hence hardly, against EWA ii 373, to prá+ √sthā in a sense ʻ prominent ʼ, and if conn. pr̥ṣṭhá -- ʻ back ʼ as ablaut variant, the sense ʻ ridge ʼ of pr̥ṣṭhyā -- , Germ. First and the sense ʻ vertebrae ʼ of pr̥ṣṭí -- may be secondary -- cf. Dm. (J. C. W.)]
Pa. pattha -- m. ʻ lonely place, wilderness ʼ;

lang: Language of `Kharoṣṭhī Inscriptions discovered by Sir Aurel Stein in Chinese Turkestan' edited by A. M. Boyer, E. J. Rapson, and E. Senart
